responses: A fever can indicate your body is fighting an infection. Monitor your temperature and stay hydrated.
If your fever is above 103°F (39.4°C) or lasts more than 3 days, please see a doctor.
Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and consider taking fever-reducing medication if needed.

responses: Common cold symptoms include runny nose, sneezing, and congestion. Rest and stay hydrated.
A cold typically lasts 7-10 days. If symptoms worsen, consult a doctor.
Get plenty of rest, drink fluids, and consider over-the-counter cold medications.

responses: Flu symptoms include fever, body aches, fatigue, and respiratory issues. Rest is important.
The flu can be serious. Stay hydrated, rest, and consider seeing a doctor if symptoms are severe.
Antiviral medications work best when started within 48 hours of symptom onset.

If your cough lasts more than 3 weeks or you're coughing up blood, see a doctor.
Try honey and warm liquids to soothe your throat. Rest your voice.
